instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..
definitions.PPVCORE_GPU: What is PPVCORE_GPU? This is the main power rail for the GPU. This is required for the GPU to turn on so you can get image on the display. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> GPU IG0R Sensor Error
threads.message:
I bought this board untested from eBay, when I got it and the board was fully working. 
I've notice <CAPACITOR>C8363</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C8360</CAPACITOR> tantalum caps has knocked off when I got the board, so i decided to replace these caps from a donor board but I accidentally soldered both caps in the wrong polarity. I power it up and i get a blank screen. so I check the cap and I realised this must have shorted the PP1v5R1V35 line. I took the caps out and soldered the right polarity this time. i power the board up but i still get blank screen. <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_GPU</SIGNAL> was 0v, then i decide to touch up the solder on <CHIP>U8900</CHIP>. but i was still getting a blank screen. i then replace <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> and bingo i got a picture 

Then i decide to run ASD and 1 sensor error comes up:


[IMG type="full" width="200px"]https://i.imgur.com/86pdtmU.jpg[/IMG]

[URL="https://i.imgur.com/4KRPgoC.jpg"][IMG type="full" width="200px"]https://i.imgur.com/4KRPgoC.jpg[/IMG][/URL]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> GPU IG0R Sensor Error
threads.message: bump, i still need help with this.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> GPU IG0R Sensor Error
threads.message:
What does <RESISTOR>R5410</RESISTOR>/<CHIP>U5410</CHIP>/<RESISTOR>R5413</RESISTOR> area look like? I am guessing <CAPACITOR>C5413</CAPACITOR> leaking and pulling the value down.

Duke is on vacation and I got a concussion so replies will be slow for a while until he comes back or my dizziness/constant headache goes away.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> GPU IG0R Sensor Error
threads.message:
Check <CHIP>U5410</CHIP> and its traces tu <RESISTOR>R5410</RESISTOR>.
The problem should be on the input, as the error message reports high reading.
Be sure <RESISTOR>R5410</RESISTOR> is correct R003. Incorrect R005 can cause this kind of error.
Is also possible that GPU sinks more current than expected. In such case, try to use R002 for <RESISTOR>R5410</RESISTOR>.
If doesn't help, a resistor in parallel with <CAPACITOR>C5413</CAPACITOR> (must be calculated/tested) can reduce the signal.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> GPU IG0R Sensor Error
threads.message:
they all looks good and all within spec. i even replaced <CHIP>U5410</CHIP> and <CAPACITOR>C5413</CAPACITOR>.

i will try r002 for <RESISTOR>R5410</RESISTOR>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> GPU IG0R Sensor Error
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> GPU IG0R Sensor Error
threads.message:
I need help editing the serial number of this eBay board to match the serial number to the one on the bottom cover.
The system serial number has become "not available" after editing the SPI ROM. the board can read original serial number but not mine one.

this usually works for me but not this time....

This is what I've done so far: I removed the ROM from the eBay board and put it into my EPROM programmer. I then used that to dump the ROM and opened the resulting file in a hex editor. I located the eBay board serial number in the file and changed it to the desired number. I made sure not to add any extra spaces or anything, and made sure the string was still located at the same offsets as the original. I saved the file and wrote it back onto the ROM. i have even tried just writing zeros then use Blank Board Serializer to write the number that way, but it just had an error and wouldn't do anything.

This is the ROM, ME region is all good, just want the serial number to change:

[URL="https://drive.google.com/open?id=1uiiEmMvejOlK_y7EDqSnZe8yz428_pFF"]https://drive.google.com/open?id=1ui...SnZe8yz428_pFF[/URL]

the serial number i want. : C02JC22TDKQ4
